title: The value of a baseline in determining design success
proctitle: CHI '94: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

references.text: Dieli, M. The usability process: Working with iterative design principles. IEEE Transactions on Professional Communications, 1989, 32, pp. 272- 278.
Gould, J.D. and Lewis, C. Designing for usability: key principles and what designers think. Communications of the ACM, 1985, 28, pp. 300- 311.

Hutchins, E. L., Hollan, J. D. and Norman, D. A. Direct manipulation interfaces, in User Centered System Design: New Perspectives on Human- Computer Interaction, D. A. Norman and S. W. Draper, Eds., Lawrence Erlbaum Associates, New York, 1986, pp. 87-124.

Kellogg, W. Conceptual consistency in the user interface: Effects on user performance, in Proceedings of the International Conference on Human-Computer Interaction, H. Bullinger and B. Shackel, Eds., Elsevier Science Publishers, New York, 1987, pp. 389-394.
Nielsen, J. Usability Engineering. Academic Press, New York, 1993.

Payne S. J. and Green, T. R. G. Task action grammars: A model of the mental representation of task languages, in Human-Computer Interaction, Volume 2, Lawrence Erlbaurn Associates, New York, 1986, pp. 93-133.
Rutkowski, C. An introduction to the human applications standard computer interface, in BYTE Magazine, October and November, 1982.
Shneiderman, B. Designing the User Interface: Strategies for Effective Human-Computer Interaction. Addison Wesley Publishing Company, New York, 1987.
Tognazzini, B. Achieving consistency for the Macintosh, in Coordinating User Interfaces for Consistency, J. Nielsen, Ed., Academic Press, New York, 1989, pp. 57-73.
Velte, C. Document usability through objectives. IEEE Transactions on Professional Communications, 1989, 32, pp. 279-282.
Whitefield, A., Wilson, F. and Dowell, J. A framework for human factors evaluation. Behaviour & Information Technology, 1991, 10, pp. 65-79.

Whiteside, J., Bennett, J. and Holtzblatt, K. Usability Engineering: Our Experience and Evolution, in Handbook of Human-Computer Interaction, M. Helander, Ed., Elsevier Science Publishers, North Holland, 1988, pp. 791-871.
